items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 40 South Market Street, San Jose, CA 95113
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 40 South Market Street, San Jose, CA 95113

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
	 
Short-Term Job Description Revision
Assistant Coach, Athletics, District-Wide effective 01/01/15
Assistant Coach/Off-Season, District-Wide effective 01/01/15

items.item_details:
The Alliance for Language Learners Integration, Education and Success (ALLIES) brings together adult schools and community colleges to meet the needs of adult English language learners in San Mateo and Santa Clara Counties. ALLIES works to help students achieve economic self-sufficiency by equipping them with language and other needed skills and providing crucial workforce development support.  ALLIESâ purpose is to accelerate student academic and economic success though collaboration and alignment across the two systems.  
	 
The Immigrant Integration Fund of Silicon Valley Community Foundation is partnering with Evergreen Valley College and has awarded grant funds in the amount of $40,352 as support to develop ALLIES as a resource and advocate for the coordinated delivery of best-practice adult English language acquisition.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees accept grant funds in the amount of $40,352 from the Immigrant Integration Fund of Silicon Valley Community Foundation.
items.item_text: Acceptance of Grant Funds for Evergreen Valley College from Silicon Valley Community Foundation

items.item_details:
On  October 14, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract in the amount of $74,308.32 with Dasher Technologies for network cabling installation at the new District Office location at 40 S. Market St.    This change order request is to provide additional network cabling and data connections for networked printers, phones, computers and audio-visual equipment.  
	 
Dasher Technologies submitted a written pricing proposal for these changes (copy attached).  The proposal has been reviewed to assure that the pricing is in compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount           $74,308.32
Previously approved changes               0.00
Change Order No. 0001                 7,537.48
Revised Contract amount           $81,845.80
	 
The net change to Dasher Technologies' contract is 10.1% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency.  No additional funding is required.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a change order to Dasher Technologies for additional network cabling and data connections at the new District Office, per the attached quote, for $7,537.48.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program - Network Cabling Change Order for District Office
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G-2010 Bond Program - Network Cabling Change Order for District Office

items.item_details: The attached Resolution of Intention to Lease School Property requests bids from the public for the development of the District's 27.1 acres of land that was previously declared surplus by the Board of Trustees.   The bids will propose development of the land pursuant to a long term ground lease.  The selected developer will be responsible for obtaining entitlements, funding all development costs and paying rent to the District.  The District may accept or reject any bids received.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 012715-1 of the District's intention to lease school property.
items.item_text: Resolution of Intention to Lease School Property
items.item_text_raw: 1. Resolution of Intention to Lease School Property

items.item_details:
In response to AB86 Legislation, the California Community College Chancellor’s Office (CCCCO) allocated $657,493 for the greater south bay region to develop a regional plan that will better serve the educational needs of adults. 
	 
As a result, the South Bay Consortium for Adult Education (SBCAE) was formed in collaboration with two Community College Districts (San Jose/Evergreen and West Valley/Mission) and five Adult Schools (Campbell, East Side, Milpitas, Santa Clara and Silicon Valley).  This collaboration is the third largest AB86 Consortium in the State which in 2013-14 served a total of 44,574 adult learners in the five program areas defined by AB86. The program areas are:
Elementary and secondary basic skills including classes required for a high school diploma or high school equivalency certificate
Classes and courses for immigrants eligible for educational services in citizenship and English as a Second Language (ESL) and workforce preparation classes in basic skills including Citizenship 
Educational programs for adults with disabilities
Short-term career technical programs with high employment potential
Programs for apprentices
	 
The SBCAE developed a comprehensive adult education plan and submitted it to the State in December 2014.  This information item is intended to provide a summary of the final report including the “No Wrong Door” program model that will help all residents meet their educational and workforce goals, regardless of income, prior education, and/or personal circumstances.
items.item_text: AB86 - South Bay Consortium for Adult Education (SBCAE) Regional Comprehensive Plan
items.item_text_raw: 1. AB86 - South Bay Consortium for Adult Education (SBCAE) Regional Comprehensive Plan

items.item_details:
The San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation established by the Board of Trustees in 1982 as a 501(c)(3) is the district’s vehicle for collecting and processing philanthropic dollars for the district and its two colleges.  Its Advancement Team creates and strengthens relationships within the local community to encourage advocacy, financial commitment and support for the district and its mission. 
	 
On an annual basis, the Foundation reports on its fiscal and programmatic activities. Since the last report to the Board of Trustees, the Foundation’s Advancement Team has enhanced its infrastructure to increase philanthropic capacity, established open two-way communication with stakeholders, involved partners, and inspired a culture of giving among alumni, faculty, staff and community members. 
	 
For 2015, the Advancement Team will launch its first Annual Fund Campaign in conjunction with the district’s grand opening of the 40 South Market building.  In addition, a donor recognition society has been established.  Trustees will be provided information related to these activities.
items.item_text: SJECCD Foundation Annual Report
items.item_text_raw: 2. SJECCD Foundation Annual Report

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees  establishes annual priorities for the Chancellor.  Over the last five years, these priorities have been continually revised and reorganized to reflect the evolution of the board's governance process and emerging institutional needs.  Information-based decision making is a cornerstone of the Board's policy development process; as such, the 2013/2016  Strategic Priorities set by the board reflect the findings resulting from ongoing institutional effectiveness and student success performance measures.  It is important to note that this is the first time that the Annual Report will be used to document the State of the District.
 
San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Board Strategic  Goals and Priorities  2013/2016
	 
 
I.   Student Success
San Jose-Evergreen Community College District will improve student success through enhanced educational services and programs and strengthened community engagement.
	 
II. Total Work Environment
San Jose-Evergreen Community College District will promote a total work environment that contributes to the success and development of its students and employees.
	 
III. Workforce and Economic Development
San Jose-Evergreen Community College District will respond to the workforce needs of the Silicon Valley.
	 
IV. Organizational Effectiveness and Sustainability
San Jose-Evergreen Community College District will develop systems that promote institutional effectiveness and fiscal sustainability.
	 
V.   Technology
San Jose-Evergreen Community College District will invest in information technology solutions that enhance the learning environment and support student success.
	 
VI. Communications
San Jose-Evergreen Community College District will engage in proactive communication with internal and external audiences to improve stakeholder satisfaction
